intro: Cynanchum fasciculiflorum, commonly known as the clustered-flower milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which is characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually pale green to yellowish in color, attracting various pollinators. Due to its adaptability to harsh environments, it is often found in rocky soils and open grasslands.
